name: rectifiable
content:
rectifiable adjective
(CORRECT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal possible to rectify (= correct): I think the problem is serious, but it's rectifiable. Should a rectifiable fault be found, it can typically be repaired and returned within 28 days. Related word
rectify
More examplesFewer examplesHe said he had identified the problems and that they were rectifiable.There will be no penalty in respect of any mistake in customs documentation which is easily rectifiable.It is a pity that such easily rectifiable faults have been allowed to pass.

Making things better
rectifiable adjective
(CURVE)
mathematics
  specialized In mathematics, a rectifiable curve has a finite (= limited) length: rectifiable curve By a rectifiable curve, we mean one that is continuous and has finite arc-length.
More examplesFewer examplesRepeating this construction enough times, we obtain a rectifiable curve.In fact, all rectifiable paths have this property.Since Lipschitz paths are rectifiable, we are only interested in the case A < 1.
